thread.title: Rams' Britt misses second straight practice with shoulder issue
thread.title_full: Rams' Britt misses second straight practice with shoulder issue | Fox News

author: FoxSports
title: Rams' Britt misses second straight practice with shoulder issue
text:
SAN DIEGO, CA - NOVEMBER 23: Kenny Britt #81 of the St. Louis Rams makes a catch down to the six yard line with a minute fifteen seconds left against the San Diego Chargers at Qualcomm Stadium on November 23, 2014 in San Diego, California. The Chargers won 27-24. (Photo by Stephen Dunn/Getty Images)
St. Louis Rams wide receiver Kenny Britt missed practice for a second straight day due to an ailing shoulder.
Britt, who is tied with tight end Jared Cook with a team-high 11 catches and leads the Rams with 183 yards receiving, banged his shoulder in Sunday's game against the Pittsburgh Steelers, coach Jeff Fisher said per the St. Louis Post-Dispatch .
Linebacker James Laurinaitis also missed practice for a second straight day but his absence was not listed as injury-related.
St. Louis is already thin at wideout with Brian Quick inactive for the first three games. Quick suffered a major shoulder injury last season but has not been on the injury list.
Britt is coming off a big game in the 12-6 loss to the Steelers, hauling in seven receptions for 102 yards. It was his third 100-yard game since joining the Rams prior to last season.
